channel.title: How do i edit starter?
channel.description: Were do i go to edit my starter for new players when they join were do i go and search for what?

item.title: How do i edit starter?
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

as in what they wear when they login = player.java. search id for what they wear, change the id or delete it.

command = client.java, search for starter delete the starter.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i edit starter?
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“The Soul, post:9, topic:258978”][quote author=imantai link=topic=341978.msg2645080#msg2645080 date=1233169403]
Lol sorry im not as stupid as u you dont edit a player.class. and i do no what classes files are… jeez. and im useing a delta source… my starter in player.java
[/quote]

If you think ‘class files’ are things in the matter of ‘Haha.class’ then you’re wrong, a class is basically something that stores all of the packets, methods, etc. in.[/quote]

@imantai, The Soul is correct, you refrence the Java file by saying the name followed by class.

Example,
Hello.java = The Hello class.
You.java = The You class.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i edit starter?
item.dc:creator: @adamhelloman8 adamhelloman8
item.description:
@adamhelloman8 wrote:

open client.java

Search (ctrl + f) for starter

Keep pressing enter untill you see something like this

} if (starter == 0) { starter = 1; addItem(995, 20000000); addItem(1323, 1); addItem(1191, 1); addItem(841, 1); addItem(882, 1000); addItem(554, 10000); addItem(561, 10000); addItem(392, 100); addItem(860, 1000);

Yours wont be those exact numbers, but it will be addItem(860[itemid], 100[ammount]

Read full topic

item.title: How do i edit starter?
item.dc:creator: @Kalvin Kalvin
item.description:
@Kalvin wrote:

It depends what source you’re using if you’re using deltascape then Go in client.java and search for

if(starter == 0){

Then below that you should see some codes like

addItem(1323, 1); addItem(882, 1000); addItem(995, 12000000); addItem(1725, 1); addItem(542, 1); addItem(554, 1000);

Just edit the item id then the amount. Then save and compile

Read full topic
